greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists: n, in the center of the row and the pairs of noncomposite numbers that are equidistant to n, as shown below in the example.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
maple: for n from 1 to 10 do for k from 1 to 2*n-1 do if(k=n or (isnotcomp(k) and isnotcomp(2*n-k)))then print(k):fi:od:od: # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Apr 18 2011
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 14 2009
